Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a brown pottery slightly grooved vessel, the fabric is partly greyish in section, the exterior is covered with a pale red-brown slip and faint traces of at least two lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394779) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394779)
